DataElement.preferredDefinition: One or more sequences of letters, numbers, and other characters in the MCL identifier format (ex. MCL75_001_10100) that uniquely identifies a biospecimen that was next to the one obtained for research purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Next to or adjoining._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Next to or adjoining.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 3/31/22 jk released for HTAN use. 2/2/22 jk created for SRRS Biospecimen upload data set.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The MCL biospecimen identifier which is comprised of the MCL participant identifier and a unique specimen number (ex. MCL75_001_10100).

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Consortium for Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screen-Detected Lesions Biospecimen Identifier
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.longName: Consortium for Molecular and Cellular Characterization of Screen-Detected Lesions
Concepts.definition: A consortium consisting of independent, multi-disciplinary teams that undertake comprehensive molecular and cellular characterizations of tumor tissue, cell, and microenvironment components to distinguish screen-detected early lesions from interval and symptom-detected cancers.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
